revised_title: Stationary Properties of Dispersive Optical Bistability in a Dense Exciton-Biexciton System: Copper Chloride
tldr: The authors study the stationary properties of dispersive optical bistability in a dense exciton-biexciton system using copper chloride. They use a semiclassical exciton-biexciton model to obtain the stationary solutions for optical bistability by numerical integration of the second-order Maxwell equation. The results show that the nonlinearity causing optical bistability is nearly of the Kerr medium type, and the two-photon biexciton resonance contributes weakly to the bistability characteristics.
